question.Q: Do you often have difficulty having a bowel movement?
Do you often resist the urge to have a bowel movement because you are too busy?

Putting off going to the bathroom can lead to a loss of normal muscle reflexes in the intestine and rectum. It can also result in a buildup and drying out of stool. Always respond to the urge to have a bowel movement.
Have you used laxatives regularly for a long time?

Talk to your doctor. Overuse of laxatives can eventually make the intestines underactive. Stop taking the laxatives; add high-fiber foods such as beans, bran, fruits, and vegetables to your diet; and drink plenty of water.

Your constipation is probably the result of a lack of fiber and fluids in your diet. Increase the amount of fiber and fluids you consume. You might also want to try a natural stool softener; several brands are available over the counter.
Are bowel movements painful?
See your doctor. Pain from an ANAL FISSURE, ANAL FISTULA, or HEMORRHOIDS may be causing your problem.
Are you currently taking medication?
Talk to your doctor. Some drugs can cause constipation.
Are you on a diet, or does your diet lack sufficient amounts of water and high-fiber foods such as fruit, vegetables, whole grains, and legumes?
You may not be eating enough or you may not be getting enough water or fiber in your diet to stimulate bowel movements.
Are you pregnant?
Constipation is common during pregnancy.

Do you have two or more Of the following symptoms? 
• Frequently feeling cold 
• Dry skin or hair • Unexplained weight gain 
• unexplained fatigue
See your doctor. You may have an underactive thyroid gland.
Do you have lower abdominal pain?
Have you had similar episodes of pain and constipation for many years?
See your doctor. You probably have IRRITABLE BOWEL SYNDROME.
See a doctor immediately. You may have Diverticular disease, or you could have COLON CANCER.
See your doctor if you are unable to make a diagnosis from this chat and the constipation persists for more than 2 weeks or you do not have any bowel movements for 3 days or more.
